claim.text: permitted residential uses in commercial zones without conditional use permits
claim.claim: LA Adaptive Reuse Ordinance permitted residential uses in commercial zones by-right

results.summary: The LA Adaptive Reuse Ordinance does permit residential conversions in commercial zones by-right, eliminating the need for conditional use permits or zone changes.
results.detail: The Los Angeles Adaptive Reuse Ordinance, first adopted in 1999 for Downtown LA and expanded citywide in 2003, specifically allows the conversion of older commercial and industrial buildings to residential use without requiring conditional use permits, zone changes, or variances. This by-right provision is a core feature of the ordinance designed to streamline the conversion process. The ordinance applies to buildings constructed before specific dates depending on the zone.
sources: Unable to verify via web search - based on existing knowledge of the ordinance. Recommend verifying with LA City Planning Department official documentation.

claim.text: New Jersey's Urban Transit Hub Tax Credit program (2007)
claim.claim: New Jersey enacted the Urban Transit Hub Tax Credit program in 2007

results.summary: New Jersey's Urban Transit Hub Tax Credit (UTHTC) program was enacted in 2007 through the New Jersey Economic Stimulus Act.
results.detail: The Urban Transit Hub Tax Credit program was established by the New Jersey Economic Stimulus Act of 2007 (P.L. 2007, c. 346). The program was designed to encourage economic development in designated urban transit hub areas by providing tax credits for businesses that invest capital and create jobs near transit hubs. It was administered by the New Jersey Economic Development Authority (NJEDA).
sources: New Jersey Economic Stimulus Act of 2007 (P.L. 2007, c. 346)
New Jersey Economic Development Authority program documentation
